channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Drains blocked at pedestrian and cycle crossing, 12th May
item.description:
Blocked drains at pedestrian crossing diagonally opposite Hare and Hounds pub. Massive puddles form at this point after sustained rain making cruising unusable. It would be good to clear the silt out before the end of the dry spell.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 397-399, Innsworth Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branch protruding into road, 12th May
item.description:
Tree branch protruding into road by Bus stop on Wellington Road, could cause damage to large vehicles passing close to the kerb.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Wellington Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown pavement, 12th May
item.description:
Grass has grown over the majority of the pavement from hilcot turning up to Colesbourne village. Too narrow to safely walk especially with the fast traffic passing. Has been reported before and case closed but needs to be cleared for safety
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Colesbourne, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple (3) potholes in path of bus wheels. Property at 1 Orchard Road shakes as buses pass over them!, 12th May
item.description:
Multiple pot holes in road in front of 1 Orchard Road. These pot holes are in the path of bus and other HGV wheels, causing significant shaking of the property (1 Orchard Road) as they pass over them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orchard Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Emergency access enquiry, 12th May
item.description:
Where Baxter Road meets Parkside Drive, Churchdown There are bollards which were placed as a planning condition of Pirton fields estate. However over the last year, there have been a few occasions where the only access point to Pirton fields has been blocked due to roadworks or car accidents or pedestrian incidents. In an emergency, not one resident knows who to contact to have these bollards lowered so residents can access their homes and leave the estate. On one occasion last year, residents were trapped in for 3 hours. Please could you advise?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkside Drive, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Bollard cover is off and causing a trip hazard/obstruction (Non illuminating bollard or post)

item.title: Storage containers and soil stockpile cordoned off taking up one lane of traffic and all footpath., 12th May
item.description:
This obstruction has reduced carriageway to single lane and blocked footpath. The location of it is particularly bad as it is now a blind corner and traffic is blocked. it is very difficult to exit and enter Everest Road, particularly at peak times. There are no traffic control measures in place. Assuming it is storage for roadworks taking place in Old Bath Road. Roadworks down as continuing until July. Could this be relocated to a location that isn't as busy, or further away from the junction. This road is also being used as a diversion route due to the works and temporary traffic lights on Old Bath Road, so even busier than usual. It is chaos at peak times. Has been going on for several weeks now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Everest Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Raised access cover on raised pavement., 12th May
item.description:
This cover belongs to the Environment Agency as it allows access to the mill race culvert that at this point passes in to Isall House. The culvert continues overground towards The Bank. The footpath has already been closed for five weeks causing local residents to cross over the busy High Street which is a GREATER HEALTH & SAFETY HAZARD than the raised cover. NOW URGENT. FAO Nicki Kelly

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32;34, High Street, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Broken/subsided paving slabs, 12th May
item.description:
The pavement outside my property (201 Brooklyn Road) has become damaged with a number of badly subsided and broken paving slabs which represent a trip/fall hazard. Issue has been present for a while but has become worse since the winter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 199, Brooklyn Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
